title: The Divine Lilas of Sri Raghava Pandita | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.text: Sri Raghava Bhavan, there is Raghava Pandit Samadhi here, Raghava Pandit's worshipable
Sri Radha Madana Mohan Deities, Sri Raghunath Das Goswami's worshipable Sri Sri Radha Raman
Deity, these are in this ghat, we know the story of Raghunath Das Goswami and Nityananda
Prabhu which happened here and the subsequent Panihatti festival.
Raghava Bhavan, the residence of Sri Raghava Pandita and his sister Damayanti is renowned
all over the three worlds.
As the eternal residence of Sri Gaurahari, Lord Gaurah Nityananda have manifested their
innumerable heart-rendering pastimes over here at Raghava Bhavan 500 years ago, located
on the bank of Ganges at Panihatti.
Lord Chaitanya would always be immersed in the mood of Srimati Radharani and would lovingly
accept the prasad brought to him by Raghava Pandita.
The Incarnation of Dhanishta Gopi
In Chaitanya Charitamrita, it has been revealed that Sri Raghava Pandita was an intimate associate
of Lord Chaitanya.
Raghavera Jali
After accepting his sannyas, Lord Chaitanya Mahaprabhu moved to reside at Jagannath Puri.
Every year during the Rathayatra festival, almost all the devotees from Bengal would
travel to Puri to unite with Lord Gaurasundara once again.
Sri Mati Damayanti Devi would cook innumerable items for Mahaprabhu with her love and affection
and devotion and thereafter pack these in separate bags.
Raghava Pandita would then carry these bags to Puri during his annual visit and offer
them to Lord Chaitanya.
These bags of delicious food items came to be subsequently known as Raghavera Jali, the
bags of Raghavendra Pandita.
And they find a very special mention in Chaitanya Bhagavata and Sri Chaitanya Charitamrita.
Sri Krishnadas Kaviraj conceded in Chaitanya Charitamrita that it was impossible in one's
lifetime to list down all the wonderful eatables contained in Chaitanya Chaitanya Bhagavata's
food items.
It was impossible in one's lifetime to list down all the wonderful eatables contained
in Chaitanya Charitamrita.
It was impossible in one's lifetime to list down all the wonderful eatables contained in
Raghavera Jali.
It was the love and devotion of both brother and sister that made these foodstuffs even
more tasty.
Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu would honor and relish them for a continuous one year until
Raghava Pandita brought fresh food items.

ecstatic pastimes at the following four places, the house of Mother Sachi, that is Satchira
Mandira, wherever Nithyananda Prabhu dances, that is Nithyananda Narthena, then during
Sankirtana at the house of Shiva's Pandit, Shiva's Angan and the residence of Raghava
Pandit, Raghava Bhavan.
Whenever Nithyananda Prabhu and his associate used to return to Bengal from Puri, they used
to stay at Raghava Bhavan.
Nithyananda Prabhu has manifested many awe-inspiring pastimes here.
It was here at Panihatti on the bank of Ganges that Raghunath Das Goswami, the son of the
earth's white wealthy landlord of Saptagram, Sri Govardhan Majumdar, had received the
costless mercy of Sri Nithyananda Prabhu.
It was Nithyananda Prabhu's mercy that enabled Sri Raghunatha to later obtain the
shelter and service at the feet of Lord Chaitanya.
Raghunatha went on to become one of the six Goswamis of Vrindavana and is renowned all
over the three worlds for his renunciation and love for the Supreme.
So that is Panihatti.
So we know about the Panihatti festival.
Nithyananda Prabhu was there and Raghunatha Goswami, Raghunatha was ordered to feed all
the brahmanas, all the devotees and every year at Panihatti this festival is commemorated.
